p: New effective drugs targeting the polymerase would be a promising strategy against IAV infection, since they would directly reduce or eliminate viral replication. Numerous sites, including the cap-binding site [ 228], the endonuclease [ 229, 230], and PA-PB1 inter-subunit interface [ 231] can serve as potential targeting sites for new drug design. Coumarin compounds, including Eleutheroside B 1, Isofraxidin, Fraxin, Esculetin, Fraxetin, and Scoparone, were investigated for their antiviral and anti-inflammatory activities against influenza virus in vitro [ 31].
